com.turn.ttorrent.client.storage

Class FileCollectionStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.ttorrent.client.storage.FileCollectionStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TorrentByteStorage

    public class FileCollectionStorage
extends Object
implements TorrentByteStorage
    Multi-file torrent byte storage.

    This implementation of the torrent byte storage provides support for multi-file torrents and completely abstracts the read/write operations from the notion of different files. The byte storage is represented as one continuous byte storage, directly accessible by offset regardless of which file this offset lands.

    Author:
    mpetazzoni, dgiffin

      • read

        public int read(ByteBuffer buffer,
                long offset)
         throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: TorrentByteStorage
        Read from the byte storage.

        Read length bytes at offset offset from the underlying byte storage and return them in a ByteBuffer.

        Specified by:
        read in interface TorrentByteStorage
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the bytes into. The buffer's limit will control how many bytes are read from the storage.
        offset - The offset, in bytes, to read from. This must be within the storage boundary.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read from the storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the byte storage.

      • write

        public int write(ByteBuffer buffer,
                 long offset)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: TorrentByteStorage
        Write bytes to the byte storage.

        Specified by:
        write in interface TorrentByteStorage
        Parameters:
        buffer - A ByteBuffer containing the bytes to write to the storage. The buffer limit is expected to be set correctly: all bytes from the buffer will be used.
        offset - Offset in the underlying byte storage to write the block at.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written to the storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the byte storage.

      • finish

        public void finish()
            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: TorrentByteStorage
        Finalize the byte storage when the download is complete.

        This gives the byte storage the opportunity to perform finalization operations when the download completes, like moving the files from a temporary location to their destination.

        Specified by:
        finish in interface TorrentByteStorage
        Throws:
        IOException - If the finalization failed.
